Specra provides a powerful yet flexible system for documenting REST APIs. Whether you have 5 endpoints or 500, we've got you covered.

## Two Approaches

### 1. Auto-Generated Documentation

Perfect for large APIs or when you already have specs.

<div className="grid grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-3 gap-4 not-prose my-6">
  <div className="border border-border rounded-lg p-4">
    <div className="text-2xl mb-2">ðŸ“‹</div>
    <h4 className="font-semibold mb-1">Specra Format</h4>
    <p className="text-sm text-muted-foreground">Simple JSON format</p>
  </div>
  <div className="border border-border rounded-lg p-4">
    <div className="text-2xl mb-2">ðŸ”§</div>
    <h4 className="font-semibold mb-1">OpenAPI 3.x</h4>
    <p className="text-sm text-muted-foreground">Industry standard</p>
  </div>
  <div className="border border-border rounded-lg p-4">
    <div className="text-2xl mb-2">ðŸ“®</div>
    <h4 className="font-semibold mb-1">Postman v2.x</h4>
    <p className="text-sm text-muted-foreground">Export from Postman</p>
  </div>
</div>

Simply create or export your spec file and reference it:

```mdx
<ApiReference spec="/api-specs/my-api.json" />
```

The system **auto-detects** the format and generates beautiful, interactive documentation.

**Examples:**
- [Specra Format (JSONPlaceholder) â†’](/docs/v1.0.0/api-test)
- [OpenAPI 3.0 Format â†’](/docs/v1.0.0/api-openapi)
- [Postman Collection â†’](/docs/v1.0.0/api-postman)

[Learn More About Formats â†’](/docs/v1.0.0/api-formats)

---

### 2. Manual MDX Components

Perfect for small APIs or when you need custom layouts.

Use individual components to craft your documentation:

```mdx
<ApiEndpoint
  method="GET"
  path="/api/users/:id"
  summary="Get user by ID"
>
  <ApiParams params={[...]} />
  <ApiResponse status={200} example={{...}} />
  <ApiPlayground method="GET" path="/api/users/123" />
</ApiEndpoint>
```

**Example:**
- [Manual Component Example â†’](/docs/v1.0.0/api-example)

---

## Quick Start

### Auto-Generated (Recommended)

1. **Create your spec file** (Specra, OpenAPI, or Postman)
2. **Place it in** `/public/api-specs/my-api.json`
3. **Add to your MDX**:

```mdx
---
title: API Reference
---

# My API Documentation

<ApiReference spec="/api-specs/my-api.json" />
```

That's it! You now have:
- âœ… Auto-generated endpoint documentation
- âœ… Interactive API playground
- âœ… Collapsible accordion UI
- âœ… Syntax-highlighted examples
- âœ… Request/response schemas

### Manual Components

1. **Create an MDX file** in `docs/`
2. **Use API components**:

```mdx
---
title: API Reference
---

# My API

<ApiEndpoint method="GET" path="/users" summary="List users">
  <ApiParams
    title="Query Parameters"
    params={[
      { name: "page", type: "number", description: "Page number" }
    ]}
  />

  <ApiResponse
    status={200}
    description="Success"
    example={[{ id: 1, name: "John" }]}
  />

  <ApiPlayground
    method="GET"
    path="/users"
    baseUrl="https://api.example.com"
  />
</ApiEndpoint>
```

## Available Components

### `<ApiReference>`

Auto-generate docs from spec files.

```tsx
<ApiReference
  spec="/api-specs/my-api.json"  // Path to spec file
  parser="auto"                   // auto | specra | openapi | postman
  showPlayground={true}           // Show interactive playground
/>
```

### `<ApiEndpoint>`

Document a single endpoint (accordion-style).

```tsx
<ApiEndpoint
  method="GET"              // GET | POST | PUT | PATCH | DELETE
  path="/api/users/:id"     // API path
  summary="Get user by ID"  // Short description
  defaultOpen={false}       // Start expanded?
>
  {/* Child components */}
</ApiEndpoint>
```

### `<ApiParams>`

Display parameters (path, query, body).

```tsx
<ApiParams
  title="Path Parameters"
  params={[
    {
      name: "id",
      type: "string",
      required: true,
      description: "User ID",
      example: "user_123"
    }
  ]}
/>
```

### `<ApiResponse>`

Show response examples.

```tsx
<ApiResponse
  status={200}
  description="User found"
  example={{
    id: "user_123",
    name: "John Doe",
    email: "john@example.com"
  }}
/>
```

### `<ApiPlayground>`

Interactive API testing.

```tsx
<ApiPlayground
  method="GET"
  path="/users/:id"
  baseUrl="https://api.example.com"
  headers={{ "Authorization": "Bearer ..." }}
  pathParams={[
    { name: "id", type: "string", example: "user_123" }
  ]}
  defaultBody='{"key": "value"}'
/>
```

## Features

### Interactive Playground

Every endpoint includes a built-in playground where users can:
- âœ… Edit path parameters
- âœ… Modify request headers
- âœ… Update request body
- âœ… Send real API requests
- âœ… View formatted responses

### Accordion UI

Endpoints are collapsible by default, making it easy to:
- Browse many endpoints quickly
- Expand only what you need
- Keep the page clean and organized

### Syntax Highlighting

All code examples include:
- JSON syntax highlighting
- Line numbers
- Copy button
- Dark mode support

### Authentication

Document your auth requirements:
- Bearer tokens
- API keys
- Basic auth
- Custom headers

## Format Support

| Format | Version | Use Case |
|--------|---------|----------|
| **Specra** | 1.0 | Simple, custom format for any API |
| **OpenAPI** | 3.x, Swagger 2.0 | Industry standard, code generation |
| **Postman** | Collection v2.x | Postman users, quick export |

[Compare Formats â†’](/docs/v1.0.0/api-formats)

## Best Practices

### 1. Choose the Right Approach

**Use auto-generated** when:
- You have > 10 endpoints
- You already have a spec file
- You want consistency
- You need code generation

**Use manual components** when:
- You have < 10 endpoints
- You need custom layouts
- You want full control
- You're documenting gradually

### 2. Provide Examples

Always include realistic examples:
- Request bodies with actual data
- Response examples that match reality
- Edge cases and errors
- Authentication examples

### 3. Keep It Updated

**For auto-generated docs:**
- Regenerate specs when code changes
- Re-export Postman collections regularly
- Version your spec files

**For manual docs:**
- Review when API changes
- Test playground regularly
- Update examples

### 4. Organize by Feature

Group related endpoints:

```mdx
## User Management

<ApiReference spec="/api-specs/users.json" />

## Product Catalog

<ApiReference spec="/api-specs/products.json" />

## Orders

<ApiReference spec="/api-specs/orders.json" />
```

### 5. Add Context

Enhance with explanatory text:

```mdx
## Authentication

All endpoints require a valid JWT token.

<Callout type="info">
Get your API key from the [developer dashboard](https://example.com/dashboard).
</Callout>

<ApiReference spec="/api-specs/my-api.json" />
```
